byline.contributor: Azam Ahmed contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Securities and Exchange Commission adopts rule requiring large hedge funds to report detailed information on their investments and borrowings, in bid to limit and monitor risks to the financial system.
snippet: The rule adopted Wednesday requires large funds to report details of their holdings in a bid to limit risks to the financial system.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

lead_paragraph: The rule adopted Wednesday requires large funds to report details of their holdings in a bid to limit risks to the financial system.

headline.main: Rule Allows U.S. a Close Look at Big Hedge Funds
headline.print_headline: Rule Allows U.S. a Close Look at Big Hedge Funds
headline.seo: Rule to Allow Regulators Detailed Look at Big Hedge Funds
